t: Matthew 23
Woe to the Scribes and Pharisees
Then*p Jesus spoke to the multitudes and to His disciples,
saying: “The*r scribes*r and*r the*r Pharisees*r sit*r in*r Moses’*r seat.*r
Therefore*r whatever*r they*r tell*r you*r to*r observe,*r that*ir observe*r and*r do,*r but*r do*r not*r do*r according*r to*r their*r works;*r for*r they*r say,*r and*r do*r not*r do.*r
For*r they*r bind*r heavy*r burdens,*r hard*r to*r bear,*r and*r lay*r them*ir on*r men’s*r shoulders;*r but*r they*r themselves*ir will*r not*r move*r them*r with*r one*r of*r their*r fingers.*r
But*r all*r their*r works*r they*r do*r to*r be*r seen*r by*r men.*r They*r make*r their*r phylacteries*r broad*r and*r enlarge*r the*r borders*r of*r their*r garments.*r
They*r love*r the*r best*r places*r at*r feasts,*r the*r best*r seats*r in*r the*r synagogues,*r
greetings*r in*r the*r marketplaces,*r and*r to*r be*r called*r by*r men,*r ‘Rabbi,*r Rabbi.’*r
But*r you,*r do*r not*r be*r called*r ‘Rabbi’;*r for*r One*r is*r your*r Teacher,*r the*r Christ,*r and*r you*r are*r all*r brethren.*r
Do*r not*r call*r anyone*r on*r earth*r your*r father;*r for*r One*r is*r your*r Father,*r He*r who*r is*r in*r heaven.*r
And*r do*r not*r be*r called*r teachers;*r for*r One*r is*r your*r Teacher,*r the*r Christ.*r
But*r he*r who*r is*r greatest*r among*r you*r shall*r be*r your*r servant.*r
And*r whoever*r exalts*r himself*r will*r be*r humbled,*r and*r he*r who*r humbles*r himself*r will*r be*r exalted.*r

“But*rp woe*r to*r you,*r scribes*r and*r Pharisees,*r hypocrites!*r For*r you*r shut*r up*r the*r kingdom*r of*r heaven*r against*r men;*r for*r you*r neither*r go*r in*r yourselves,*ir nor*r do*r you*r allow*r those*r who*r are*r entering*r to*r go*r in.*r

Woe*r to*r you,*r scribes*r and*r Pharisees,*r hypocrites!*r For*r you*r devour*r widows’*r houses,*r and*r for*r a*r pretense*r make*r long*r prayers.*r Therefore*r you*r will*r receive*r greater*r condemnation.*r

“Woe*rp to*r you,*r scribes*r and*r Pharisees,*r hypocrites!*r For*r you*r travel*r land*r and*r sea*r to*r win*r one*r proselyte,*r and*r when*r he*r is*r won,*r you*r make*r him*r twice*r as*r much*r a*r son*r of*r hell*r as*r yourselves.*r

“Woe*rp to*r you,*r blind*r guides,*r who*r say,*r ‘Whoever*r swears*r by*r the*r temple,*r it*r is*r nothing;*r but*r whoever*r swears*r by*r the*r gold*r of*r the*r temple,*r he*r is*r obliged*r to*ir perform*ir it.’*ir
Fools*r and*r blind!*r For*r which*r is*r greater,*r the*r gold*r or*r the*r temple*r that*r sanctifies*r the*r gold?*r
And,*r ‘Whoever*r swears*r by*r the*r altar,*r it*r is*r nothing;*r but*r whoever*r swears*r by*r the*r gift*r that*r is*r on*r it,*r he*r is*r obliged*r to*ir perform*ir it.’*ir
Fools*r and*r blind!*r For*r which*r is*r greater,*r the*r gift*r or*r the*r altar*r that*r sanctifies*r the*r gift?*r
Therefore*r he*r who*r swears*r by*r the*r altar,*r swears*r by*r it*r and*r by*r all*r things*r on*r it.*r
He*r who*r swears*r by*r the*r temple,*r swears*r by*r it*r and*r by*r Him*r who*r dwells*r in*r it.*r
And*r he*r who*r swears*r by*r heaven,*r swears*r by*r the*r throne*r of*r God*r and*r by*r Him*r who*r sits*r on*r it.*r

“Woe*rp to*r you,*r scribes*r and*r Pharisees,*r hypocrites!*r For*r you*r pay*r tithe*r of*r mint*r and*r anise*r and*r cummin,*r and*r have*r neglected*r the*r weightier*r matters*ir of*r the*r law:*r justice*r and*r mercy*r and*r faith.*r These*r you*r ought*r to*r have*r done,*r without*r leaving*r the*r others*r undone.*r
Blind*r guides,*r who*r strain*r out*r a*r gnat*r and*r swallow*r a*r camel!*r

Blind*r Pharisee,*r first*r cleanse*r the*r inside*r of*r the*r cup*r and*r dish,*r that*r the*r outside*r of*r them*r may*r be*r clean*r also.*r

“Woe*rp to*r you,*r scribes*r and*r Pharisees,*r hypocrites!*r For*r you*r are*r like*r whitewashed*r tombs*r which*r indeed*r appear*r beautiful*r outwardly,*r but*r inside*r are*r full*r of*r dead*r men’s*ir bones*r and*r all*r uncleanness.*r
Even*r so*r you*r also*r outwardly*r appear*r righteous*r to*r men,*r but*r inside*r you*r are*r full*r of*r hypocrisy*r and*r lawlessness.*r
“Woe*rp to*r you,*r scribes*r and*r Pharisees,*r hypocrites!*r Because*r you*r build*r the*r tombs*r of*r the*r prophets*r and*r adorn*r the*r monuments*r of*r the*r righteous,*r

“Therefore*rp you*r are*r witnesses*r against*r yourselves*r that*r you*r are*r sons*r of*r those*r who*r murdered*r the*r prophets.*r
Fill*r up,*r then,*r the*r measure*r of*r your*r fathers’*r guilt.*ir

Therefore,*r indeed,*r I*r send*r you*r prophets,*r wise*r men,*r and*r scribes:*r some*ir of*r them*r you*r will*r kill*r and*r crucify,*r and*r some*ir of*r them*r you*r will*r scourge*r in*r your*r synagogues*r and*r persecute*r from*r city*r to*r city,*r

that*r on*r you*r may*r come*r all*r the*r righteous*r blood*r shed*r on*r the*r earth,*r from*r the*r blood*r of*r righteous*r Abel*r to*r the*r blood*r of*r Zechariah,*r son*r of*r Berechiah,*r whom*r you*r murdered*r between*r the*r temple*r and*r the*r altar.*r
Assuredly,*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r all*r these*r things*r will*r come*r upon*r this*r generation.*r
Jesus Laments over Jerusalem

“O*rp Jerusalem,*r Jerusalem,*r the*r one*r who*r kills*r the*r prophets*r and*r stones*r those*r who*r are*r sent*r to*r her!*r How*r often*r I*r wanted*r to*r gather*r your*r children*r together,*r as*r a*r hen*r gathers*r her*r chicks*r under*r her*ir wings,*r but*r you*r were*r not*r willing!*r
See!*r Your*r house*r is*r left*r to*r you*r desolate;*r
for*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r you*r shall*r see*r Me*r no*r more*r till*r you*r say,*r ‘Blessed*r is*ir He*r who*r comes*r in*r the*r name*r of*r the*r Lord!’”*sb
